Description: Large black burnished Aeolian Grey Ware pottery trefoil oinochoe (recontructed from numerous fragments; part of rim, ring base and body missing and replaced with painted plaster); bulbous body, large oval handle with rotelles and central knob at join with rim; dull brown fabric with limestone and mica inclusions; very worn black-polished exterior; some brown and grey deposits on exterior and interior surfaces.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ8
Curator's comments: NAA was performed on a sample of this vessel (sample no. Nauk 114; results not yet published) by Hans Mommsen, Bonn. The sample was found to belong to the elemental pattern g, which can probably be traced to the region of Aeolis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.001)
Stacey et al 2010 / Coatings and contents: investigations of residues on four fragmentary sixth-century BC vessels from Naukratis (Egypt) (p.20, fig.1c, p.21, table.1, p.22)
